channel.title: The "quick way" to learn about Pascal Programming Language
channel.description:
I know that doesn't exist a quick way to learn a programming language, so that's why it is in a quote. The motive why I opened this topic is to ask where to learn Pascal programming language. The Internet is an ocean of good n' shit contents, and I don't know a trustworthy font of the subject that I never stand up to until now.
I want to slowly dive into the algorithm with "[Algorithms and Data Structures](https://web.archive.org/web/20191211063215/http://www.ethoberon.ethz.ch/WirthPubl/AD.pdf)," and does anyone knows if I need to learn Pascal first from external content to get that?

item.title: The "quick way" to learn about Pascal Programming Language
item.dc:creator: crimsonRain
item.description:
Well if you want to learn a language “quickly”, you could check out Learn Pascal in Y minutes. And since you want to learn Algorithms and such, I’d also suggest the Competitive Programmer’s Handbook if you know C++ already.

Read full topic
